titleStmt.title: Anthony Han v. King County. Sentence for Pettit Lancery

bibl.title: Anthony Han v. King County. Sentence for Pettit Lancery
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: United States of America Territory of Washington County of King SS
div1.p: To any Constable; and the Keeper of the County Jail of said County:

Whereas at a Justice Court held at my offices in White River Precinct in said county for the trial of Antony Han for the offense herein after stated the said Antony Han was convicted of having on the 22nd day of September AD 1878 in said county, committed the crime of petit larceny and upon conviction , the said court did adjudge and determine that the said Antony Han should be imprisoned in the county jail of said county for the period of six months and that he should pay a fine of twenty five dollars and if at the expiration of the six months the fine is not paid then in that case said Antony Han should be held at hard labor at said county jail until such fine is paid.

Therefore you the said Constable are commanded in the name of the United States, forthwith to carry and deliever the said Antony Han to the said Keeper; and you the said keeper as hereby commanded to receive the said Antony Hain into your custody in said
jail and him there safely keep until the expiration of said six months and until said fine is paid, or until he shall therelse be released by due course of law.
div1.ab: Dated this 1st Day of October, 1878 (Signed) Samuel Greene Justice of the Peace
Daniel U. Post is hereby authorized to act as Constable in this cause because of a vacancy in the office of Constables in White River precint (signed) Samuel Greene Justice of the Peace
